summary: On August 4, 2020, a huge explosion happened in Beirut, Lebanon, because of 2,750 tons of ammonium nitrate that had been stored unsafely for six years. The blast killed at least 218 people, hurt 7,000, and caused $15 billion in damage. It was felt and heard across the Middle East and even in parts of Europe. It was one of the biggest non-nuclear explosions ever and changed the Earth's ionosphere. People in Lebanon were very angry and protested against the government. The prime minister and his cabinet quit. The explosion also destroyed the city's grain silos.
title: 2020 Beirut explosion
